name: Hyatt Regency Dubai

reviews.text: There seems to be some confusion on the Tripadvisor web site. This review is about the older Hyatt Regency on the corniche - NOT the Hyatt Grand which seems to be shown in the pictures. I'd stayed at the Regency on a few occsions in the past when weekending over from Muscat. When taking my wife and son back to Dubai in January I'd decided the hotel from past visits to be a little run down and out of date so booked into the Dusit instead (a mistake!). However on taking my son to the ice skating rink at the Regency I was amazed at the transformation a makeover had made. So much so in fact that we booked to stay there 3 nights in February. What a fantastic change this hotel has gone through. This goes from the lobby, through to the relocated (and vastly improved bar) into the rooms. Staff were courteous and helpful at all times. Location of course is away from the 'new' Dubai but easier to get to the airport. Pool as always is a bit square and goes into the shade in the afternoon. My wife says that on the plus side its only a walk away from the gold souk! Would be my hotel of choice - if I had't stayed at the Hyatt Grand leter in the week!
reviews.title: What a transformation!!

likes.liked: — new look; ice rink in building; walking distance to gold souk and creek area
likes.disliked: — internet access - very expensive and should really be nominal fee if not free.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: Stayed there for three days....I loved the views,hotel.....and especially the service l was provided by the waiters...it was at night and the were very proffessional..Well done Hyatt..l'll definely recommend everyone there.

Third stay at the Hyatt Regency Dubai and a pleasant stay as always. Very friendly staff, rooms are clean if a bit unexciting but they have everything required for a business stay (not that I do much work in my room....). Nice bathroom. Good meal to be had in the Japanese restaurant. The one drawback was the 30 minute wait for a taxi in the morning. In future visits to Dubai I will either book a car the night before or look to stay closer to town in somewhere like the SAS Radisson or Sheraton Dubai Creek.
reviews.title: Good business hotel but location not ideal

reviews.text: This hotel is perfectly located near the sea in the heart of Dubai with excellent views over Sharjah on east, Sheikh Zayed Road and Jumeirah Beach even to Burj Al Arab on West. Al Mamzar beach is located towards Sharjah and only 15min away by taxi and the water is warm and clean.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Well you wont find a cheaper 5 star hotel in dubai thats for sure. however the hotel is poorly located unless you have you're own car, want to take taxis everywhere you go or are just here for buisness meetings, in which case it's perfect.
reviews.title: For business travellers only!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good points - The rooms are great, lots of space, comfy bed, large tv with a good choice of tv channels. air-con here is great. The main
reviews.title: Top Class Hotel with service to match

reviews.text: hotel is very stylish and a good place to people watch.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel Despite Traffic Snarls

likes.liked: — Exceptional Quality of Rooms, Amazing Food, Excellent Customer Service, BEAUTIFUL View from Rooms
likes.disliked: — Taxi/ Traffic Situation, Not Close to Major Malls, Internet was pricey and staff did not inform about cheaper internt in mall

reviews.text: Bad points - The fresh fruit in my room however was rotten. the hotel
reviews.title: All round winner!

likes.liked: — The excellent service, cleanliness and efficient running of the hotel.
likes.disliked: — probably location is a bit far from anywhere (but taxis are plentiful)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: seems to sneakily put 20% on top of everyhting they charge (even the hotel room) so be careful and read the fine print! Also, if you're on
reviews.title: Luxury all the way

description: Hyatt Regency Dubai is a deluxe hotel located on the Deira Corniche. Close to the Gold Souk, Heritage Village and only 15 minutes from the airport its 414 spacious guestrooms and elegant suites welcomes business and leisure travelers alike. Guests enjoy modern meeting facilities, complimentary internet access in the hotel lobby, an extensive fitness centre, spa, an ice skating rink and a choice of four award-winning restaurants serving international cuisines, including Al Dawaar, Dubai’s only revolving restaurant.
